medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive pain and swelling of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint of the third finger.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed symptoms over a few months of practicing recreational indoor climbing, which led him to stop all physical activities due to the pain. He reported that there was no previous local trauma, infection, or pathology before the onset and consulted his family doctor after 3 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No history of local trauma, infection, or other pathology of the finger prior to the onset of the present symptoms.
